title: Web3 Doesn't Care About Your Privacy
description: In web2, we are beholden to centralized entities that monopolize and profit off of our data. Web3 promises to release us from these shackles by enabling everyone to access data living on the blockchain. While it is certainly appealing that institutions no longer have the power to hold our data hostage, it is still important to ask: what does the public and open nature of web3 mean for our privacy?
